intro: Gimbernatia obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate gimbernatia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are typically hairy and have a rough texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white in color. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in moist, wooded areas. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
